A double solid white line
a: separates opposing lanes, and crossing the line is prohibited.

c: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction, but  crossing the line is prohibited.

title: If your parked car rolls away and hits another unattended vehicle, you should
a: sound your horn to attract attention.
b: remove your car and go on your way.
c: report the incident to the police.

title: When you see livestock near the roadway, you should
a: turn safely away from these animals.
b: follow directions from the person in charge of the animals.
c: blow your horn continuously until the animals cross the road.

title: Locked wheel skids are usually caused by
a: turning the ignition to the lock position while the vehicle is still in motion.
b: pressing the gas and brake pedals at the same time.
c: braking too hard at a high speed.

title: What is the first thing you should do during an enforcement stop?
a: turn on your right turn signal.

title: You must turn on your headlights __________ after sunset.
At an unmarked crosswalk, you must
a: stop and ask the pedestrians to cross quickly.
b: increase your speed and cross before the pedestrians.
c: yield the right-of-way to the pedestrians.

title: When you want to enter a freeway, you should
a: stop before merging into freeway traffic.
b: enter the freeway at or near the speed of freeway traffic.
c: stop and yield to the traffic on the freeway.

title: If you are ready to turn right at an intersection, and if there is a bicycle next to you on your right, who has the right-of-way when the light turns green?
Special turnout areas marked on a two-lane road
b: allow vehicles to make left turns.

title: While driving in fog, you should use your

a: continue through the intersection, then move to the left and stop.
b: move to the right and stop in the intersection.
c: continue through the intersection, then move to the right and stop.

title: Any person who willfully flees or attempts to evade law enforcement performing their duties is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by
a: up to 1 year of imprisonment in a county jail.
b: a maximum fine of up to $1,000.

title: A ___ painted curb is designated for disabled persons who display their placards.
Which of the following statements about lane markings is true?
a: a broken yellow line between opposing lanes of traffic means that you may not cross the line.
b: a solid white line between lanes of traffic means that you should stay in your lane unless a special situation requires you to change lanes.
c: a double solid line between opposing lanes of traffic means that vehicles on either side can pass.

title: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should
On a two-lane undivided highway, the maximum speed limit for vehicles towing trailers is ______ unless otherwise posted.
When you approach an intersection with a through road but without stop signs or yield signs, you must
a: yield to traffic and pedestrians on the through road.
c: make a sharp turn to mathc the speed of the traffic on the through road.

title: A traffic signal with a flashing yellow arrow means that you should
a: yield and then proceed with caution.
b: stop and be prepared to obey the next signal.
c: proceed with caution but turns are not permitted in the direction of the arrow.

title: When you park and leave your vehicle on a highway or street, you should NOT
When you turn off a high-speed, two-lane roadway, _______ if you have traffic following you.
a: try not to slow down your vehicle too quickly.
b: try to increase the speed of your vehicle.
c: try to slow down your vehicle quickly.

title: Flashing Yellow Arrow means
a: you can turn, but your turn is not protected from other traffic.
b: you can turn, and your turn is protected from other traffic.
c: you cannot turn, wait until it turns green.

title: Your vehicle breaks down on a freeway. You are not able to move the vehicle off the road completely as the road shoulder is too narrow. What is the best thing to do?
a: leave the vehicle immediately and wave at drivers ot let them know you are blocking the lane.
b: exit on the right side of your vehicle and proceed to a safe place.
c: stay inside your vehicle with the seat belt on until help arrives.

title: What is the first rule of a safe and legal turn?
b: move into the proper lane well before the turn.

title: Before reaching the crest of a hill or entering a curve, you must _________, and watch for oncoming vehicles.
a: slow down, move to the right side of the road.
b: speed up, turn on the headlights.
c: slow down, move to the left side of the road.

title: If a car approaches you with its high-beam headlights on, you must __________ to keep yourself from being temporarily blinded.
a: look at the center of the road.
b: look toward the left edge of the road.
c: look toward the right edge of the road.

title: You are driving on the freeway and notice another driver using a handheld cell phone. What is the best thing to do?
c: honk your horn and wave to the driver to get off the phone.

title: Vehicles approaching a roundabout must
a: enter the roundabout to the left of the central island.
b: come to a complete stop and wait for traffic in the roundabout to clear.
c: yield to the traffic in the roundabout.

title: A triangular orange sign on the rear of a vehicle indicates that
a: the vehicle cannot travel faster than 45 mph.
b: the vehicle cannot travel faster than 25 mph.
c: the vehicle can travel faster than 25 mph.

a: to report accidents to the police department and insurance companies.
b: to slow vehicles to a lower speed limit posted ahead.
c: to stop, slow, or guide the traffic in work zones.

title: Flashing yellow lights on a school bus require other drivers to
b: slow their vehicles and pass with caution.
c: slow their vehicles and prepare to stop.

title: If temperatures are near freezing, which freezes first?
b: both roads and bridges at the same time

c: stop, look for pedestrians, and proceed with caution.

c: the lane nearest to the right edge of the road.

title: Which of the following statements about passing a vehicle is FALSE?

c: do not pass more than one vehicle at a time.

c: at an intersection where there is no stop sign, yield sign, or traffic signal, drivers must yield to vehicles coming from the left.

title: When approaching an intersection to make a right turn, you must stay _________ and make the turn close to the right curb.
a: as close to the left as possible.

a: pass a motorcycle in the same lane.

b: vehicles must yield to pedestrians in unmarked crosswalks.

title: You may make a U-turn

title: You may make a U-turn in a residential district if
a: no vehicles are approaching you within 200 feet.
b: no vehicles are approaching you within 100 feet.

title: When you enter a highway, you will need to
a: be at or near the speed of traffic.
b: use your mirrors and turn signals.
c: make sure you can stop safely by leaving three seconds of space between you and the vehicle in front of you.

title: To exit a highway safely
a: when in the proper lane, signal five seconds (approximately 400 feet) before you exit.
b: make sure you are at a safe speed to exit.
c: do not cross over any solid lines when exiting.

title: To merge, enter, or exit traffic, you need a space that is
a: half a block on city streets, which is about 150 feet.
b: a full block on the highway, which is about 300 feet.
c: even if you have a green light, do not start across the intersection if there are pedestrians or vehicles blocking your pathway.

title: You must judge whether you have enough space to pass whenever you approach
b: a hill, curve, intersection, or road obstruction.

a: approaching a hill or curve and cannot see if other traffic is approaching.
b: within 100 feet of an intersection, bridge, tunnel, railroad crossing, or other hazardous area.

title: You may pass on the right only when
a: an open highway has two or more lanes going in your direction.
b: you are on a one-way street.
c: the driver ahead of you is turning left and you can safely pass on the right.
